problem_text:
15.71.
(B. Huppert).
Let G be a finite solvable group, and let ρ(G) denote the set of prime divisors of the degrees of irreducible characters of G. Is it true that there always exists an irreducible character of G whose degree is divisible by at least |ρ(G)|/2 different primes?
P. P. P´alfy
